prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating a Three-Dimensional, Curved Metallic Object** **Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.1617, 0.0]. **Step 2: Creating the Sketch** Create the sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of two faces: face\\_1 and face\\_2. Face\\_1 is a closed loop with four curves, while face\\_2 is a circle. For face\\_1: - Create line\\_1 from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.6469, 0.0). - Create line\\_2 from point (0.6469, 0.0) to point (0.6469, 0.4266). - Create arc\\_1 from point (0.6469, 0.4266) to point (0.3234, 0.1031) to point (0.0, 0.4266). The radius of this arc is not explicitly given in the JSON, but it can be inferred from the midpoint of the arc. - Create line\\_3 from point (0.0, 0.4266) to point (0.0, 0.0). For face\\_2: - Create circle\\_1 at point (0.3234, 0.4266) with a radius of 0.1617. **Step 3: Extruding the Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.1617 units and in the opposite direction by 0 units. Apply a sketch scale of 0.6469 to the sketch before extruding. This will create a new solid body. The final shape will be a three-dimensional, curved, metallic object with a smooth surface, resembling a stylized letter 'S' or a partial cylinder. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.6469 units, 0.1617 units, and 0.6469 units, respectively.</description>

Part 2: A Cylindrical Object with Cylindrical Hole Create a CAD model of a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center, positioned at the top of the larger cylinder. The smaller cylinder is slightly offset to the right. 1. Scale the sketch by 0.3844. 5. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.075 units and opposite normal direction by 0 units. The operation is joining existing material. The resulting CAD assembly consists of two parts: a rectangular prism and a cylindrical object with a cylindrical hole. The dimensions of the parts are as follows: - Part 1: - Height: 0.75 cm - Length: 0.375 cm - Width: 0.75 cm - Part 2: - Height: 0.3844 cm - Length: 0.075 cm - Width: 0.3844 cm</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Modeling Instructions** **Part 1: Cylindrical Object** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately twice the diameter. The object is centered on a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle (circle_1) with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. 4. Complete the sketch by closing the loop. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.1875 units. **Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners** Create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges. The top and bottom faces are flat and parallel to each other, while the front and back faces are also flat but perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are curved and smooth. The model is centered and isolated against a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0188, 0.0188, 0.1875]. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle (circle_1) with a center at [0.3562, 0.3562] and a radius of 0.3562. 4. Complete the sketch by closing the loop. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7125. 6. Extrude the sketch along the opposite normal by 0.1688 units. 7. Perform a cut feature operation. **Part 3: Sloped Prism** Create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0188, 0.3656, 0.1875]. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create five lines: - Line 1: From [0.0001, 0.0] to [0.7124, 0.0]. - Line 2: From [0.7124, 0.0] to [0.7124, 0.0188]. - Line 3: From [0.7124, 0.0188] to [0.3656, 0.0188]. - Line 4: From [0.3656, 0.0188] to [0.3468, 0.0188]. - Line 5: From [0.3468, 0.0188] to [0.0001, 0.0188]. 4. Create an arc (arc_1): - Start Point: [0.0001, 0.0187]. - Mid Point: [0.0, 0.0094]. - End Point: [0.0001, 0.0]. 5. Repeat steps 2-4 for face_2. 6. For face_2, complete the loop by connecting the arc to line_4. 7. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7124. 8. Extrude the sketch along the opposite normal by 0.1875 units.</description>
